epd_metadata.epd_owner_address: Level 40, Northpoint Tower, 100 Miller St, North Sydney NSW 2060, Australia
epd_metadata.epd_produced_by_address: Level 3, Greenhouse, 180 George Street, Sydney NSW 2000 Australia
epd_metadata.epd_process_certified_by_address: Suite 2600, 101 Marietta St NW, Atlanta, Georgia 30303, USA
epd_metadata.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

product_description.general_description: Concrete prepared by mixing cement, coarse and fine aggregates, and water, with or without auxiliary agents and additives. Placed on site or prefabricated, compacted and hardened by hydration of cement.

product_classes.normal_class: Designed for everyday applications such as residential and commercial foundations, driveways and footpaths.
product_classes.special_class: Supplied to major construction projects including high-rise buildings, dams, roads, bridges, with high strength, durability, marine application, post-tensioned, high-pumpability, super workable, piling concrete, architectural finishes and decorative applications.

product_description.hazardous_substances: None of the products contain substances listed in the Candidate List of Substances of Very High Concern for authorisation exceeding 0.1% by weight.
product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging.

lca_information.scope: Cradle to gate (modules A1-A3) with options (modules A4-A5), modules C1-C4 and module D

background_data_preferences: Product specific EPDs for cements, admixtures, pigments and fibres
Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI v1.42) (2023)
databases_and_software.note_on_impact_categories: Some impact categories (EN15804+A1 and Green Star v1.3) modelled separately based on generic processes.

allocation.method: Physical allocation based on weight or m続 of concrete; economic allocation used when physical allocation not possible.

excluded: Environmental impact from infrastructure, production equipment, and tools not directly consumed
Personnel-related impacts such as transport to/from work
cut_off_criteria.included: All materials required for manufacturing delivered without packaging except packaging of materials.

data_quality.geographic_representativeness: Good to very good for all data sources
data_quality.temporal_representativeness: All data updated within 10 years as required

installation.operational_control: Holcim does not have operational control over installation
installation.installation_process: Pouring concrete from ready-mix truck and pump, manual finishing; excludes pre-installation activities.

end_of_life.control: Holcim has no control over end-of-life fate

assumptions.deconstruction_process: Physical drilling and removal using hydraulic excavator

carbon_emission_context.carbonation_note: CO2 absorption by concrete (carbonation) not included in EPD results; recommended to consider in whole-of-life studies per BS EN 16757:2017.

allocation_method.fly_ash: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included
allocation_method.ground_granulated_blast_furnace_slag: Allocated economically due to significant economic value
allocation_method.silica_fume: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included

recycled_materials_handling.recycled_aggregate_use: Recycled aggregate replaces virgin coarse aggregate depending on product performance requirements

system_boundaries.excluded_lifecycle_stages_reason: Not applicable for Holcim's ready-mix concrete ranges

references: Australian Life Cycle Inventory Database Initiative Guidelines (2023)
British Standards Institution BS EN 15804:2012+A2:2019 and BS EN 16757:2017
Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water National Waste Report 2022
EPD International General Programme Instructions and PCR documents (2024)
Man Yu et al., Procedia Engineering, 2017
disclaimers: Results are relative statements and do not indicate endpoints, thresholds, safety margins or risks.
Some impact categories have high uncertainty or limited experience.
Ionising radiation indicator excludes nuclear accidents, occupational exposure, and radioactive waste disposal effects.
